image.altText: Peter Dutton speaks at lectern

props.synopsis: Peter Dutton tells reporters in WA that he and his team have "worked hard every day and night" during the campaign and "there's no doubt in my mind we can be successful in the election". Follow live.

title.children: Dutton has 'no doubt' Coalition can win this election as campaigning nears end

image.altText: A graphic shows a smartphone screen showing a graph.

props.synopsis: Housing, cost of living, health and Australia's energy future have been front and centre this election campaign. Here's what the Vote Compass data tells us about where respondents stand on key issues.

title.children: The key issues identified by Vote Compass as 1.2m use election tool

image.altText: roberts hanson

props.synopsis: A One Nation staffer has denied receiving commissions for introducing farmers he met through a Senate inquiry to a Brisbane law firm.

title.children: One Nation staffer reported to corruption watchdog over referrals to law firm

image.altText: A metal shard embedded in a tyre

props.synopsis: Drivers were left stranded and waiting for help after their tyres were pierced by the debris from a truck on the M1 southbound from the NSW Central Coast to Sydney.

title.children: 'It's just a disaster': Motorists describe chaos on M1 after scrap metal spill

image.altText: A close up photo of Erin Patterson looking over her shoulder wearing glases.

props.synopsis: Erin Patterson's estranged husband tells her triple-murder trial his wife had sent "inflammatory messages" to a family group chat and was being "extremely aggressive", months before a deadly family lunch.

title.children: Erin Patterson sent 'extremely aggressive' texts to estranged husband, court hears

image.altText: A man in front of a billboard which says "the parties are the problem"

props.synopsis: Hothouse Magazine has spent more than $400,000 on political Meta ads since February. Analysis shows that over 30 days it mostly targeted postcodes in seats with Climate 200-supported independent candidates.

title.children: Little-known entity comparing Dutton to Trump spends more than $400,000 on political Meta ads

image.altText: A sillouette of trump stands in front of the letters NPR

props.synopsis: The White House, in a social media posting announcing the order, says broadcasters PBS and NPR "receive millions from taxpayers to spread radical, woke propaganda disguised as 'news'".

title.children: Trump signs executive order cutting funding for public broadcasters

props.synopsis: Wills was Labor heartland, but now the seat that belonged to Bob Hawke is squarely in the marginal column.

title.children: Why Melbourne’s inner north has Labor worried

image.altText: A stylised map shows Australia's 150 federal electorates as clusters of hexagons.

props.synopsis: The electoral maths on Saturday seems simple — win 76 seats and you win government. But that's not all there is to it.

title.children: Where the election will be won and lost — or left hanging

image.altText: A mournful woman closes her eyes as her heads tilts downwards.

props.synopsis: The mother of Mackenzie Anderson, 21, says she plans to push for reform in her daughter's name after the man who stabbed her 78 times will be eligible for parole in 13 years.

title.children: Mum's outrage over 'light' sentence handed to daughter's DV murderer

image.altText: A woman with a blonde bob sits in a black dress with a white collar holding a guitar, smiling.

props.synopsis: While best known for 90s hits 'Supermodel' and 'I Kissed A Girl', Jill Sobule's career spanned three decades, 12 albums and more.

title.children: Jill Sobule, singer behind I Kissed A Girl and Supermodel, dead at 66

image.altText: A man outside his Qld home standing next to the fence at the front of the house

props.synopsis: As Australians head to the ballot box, the lack of affordable housing is posing a major issue for many. But the debate about how to constrain prices remains a sore point because millions are home owners and many have built their wealth through property.

title.children: Home owners far outnumber first-time buyers, so pollies ‘do the math’

image.altText: Gas stove top turned on. Blue flames against a dark black background.

props.synopsis: Will our cost of living pressure be eased if the federal government does more about gas, as promised?

title.children: Does more gas supply mean cheaper power bills for Australians? Here's what we know

image.altText: A man stands in front of a railway level crossing

props.synopsis: A federal candidate for the Riverina is standing by his comments slamming voters on social media, in a since-deleted post.

title.children: Candidate labels voters in his electorate 'dumbest on this planet'

image.altText: A grainy photo of a white large bead-shaped hunk of metal with 'CCCP' emblazoned in red on the sides.

props.synopsis: Scientists are keeping an eye on Kosmos 482, which is forecast to plunge back to Earth next week. We just don't know exactly when or where it will land.

title.children: Old Soviet spacecraft expected to crash back to Earth next week

image.altText: The two men standing shoulder to shoulder, Pope Francis does not look amused

props.synopsis: The conclave will be a "fight for the soul of the Catholic Church" between those who saw promise in the modernising changes Pope Francis made and those "who hated him for it".

title.children: MAGA's 'vicious fight' for the 'soul of the Catholic church'

image.altText: A jar of pencils.

props.synopsis: Think you know the numbers behind the federal election? Try our quiz!

title.children: Test your knowledge with our federal election numbers quiz

image.altText: The infamous bank building in the township of Snowtown.

props.synopsis: The nephew of one of the "bodies-in-the-barrels" murder victims has called on South Australia's Parole Board not to release convicted killer James Vlassakis, who has made a bid for parole.

title.children: Snowtown killer's parole bid 'slap in the face', says nephew of victim

image.altText: A woman slots a piece of paper into a ballot box inside a voting booth.

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory has just two lower house seats and both have long been held by Labor. But after a Country Liberal Party landslide at last year's NT election, both are crucial to the major parties' path to victory on Saturday.

title.children: The NT has just two electorates but both are key seats to watch

image.altText: A woman in an electric wheelchair named Eleanor Beidatsch pictured outside a polling place.

props.synopsis: Eleanor Beidatsch details the challenges she faces while voting in a wheelchair, while people with "invisible disabilities" can face even bigger hurdles.

title.children: For those of us with disabilities, voting can be an overwhelming experience

image.altText: a blue corflute that's been burnt and attached to a pole

props.synopsis: Candidates have seen their election signs marked with swastikas or offensive slurs, burned, vandalised, smeared with excrement, stomped on and shredded.

title.children: Hundreds of election signs destroyed or removed

image.altText: An aerial view shows a large sinkhole that formed when a sinkhole that swallowed a truck and a man

props.synopsis: The sinkhole, which was caused by corroded sewerage pipes, was first discovered in February and is now at least 40 metres wide.

title.children: Body of Japanese driver swallowed by sinkhole recovered months later

image.altText: Koren Helbig stands in her vegetable garden holding small pots containing vegetable seedlings. She is smiling.

props.synopsis: As a lazy gardener, I like plants that give me the most food for the least effort. These are my top winter picks.

title.children: Herbs and veggies to plant now to reduce your food bill in winter

image.altText: A crashed helicopter in the ocean.

props.synopsis: Three people suffered serious injuries when their helicopter crashed in water between Point Lonsdale and Ocean Grove on Victoria's Bellarine Peninsula.

title.children: Three people survive helicopter crash near Geelong

image.altText: the hull of a large ferry

props.synopsis: At 130 metres long, Hull 096 is the largest electric vehicle of its kind ever built, with the maker saying it represents a "giant leap forward in sustainable shipping".

title.children: Tasmanian-built world's largest electric ferry launches

image.altText: A mural dedicated to the Australian women killed by domestic violence in 2024 and 2025

props.synopsis: Violence against women has stirred outrage among voters and politicians have promised to do something about it. Their policy proposals tell a different story, write Heidi Davoren and Mary Lloyd.

title.children: It's the 'national crisis' that neither party has been able to solve

image.altText: Shells from dredging near Port Arthur

props.synopsis: Test yourself with this week's quiz.

title.children: Weekly news quiz: An incident at sea, a shell-based discovery and a voting refresher course

image.altText: A close up shot of a man wearing glasses and a baseball cap

props.synopsis: A man who allegedly killed WA police officer Anthony Woods has had his murder charge downgraded to manslaughter.

title.children: Murder charge over Perth police officer's death downgraded

image.altText: An aerial view of a crowd on the street

props.synopsis: Hundreds of thousands of people across the globe have held May Day protests opposing US President Donald Trump's agenda.

title.children: Global May Day protests held against Trump tariffs, administration

image.altText: A 15-year-old girl holding an AFL football with a players behind her on an oval

props.synopsis: Aussie rules teams across the Eyre Peninsula say a ruling by the SANFL that 15-year-old girls cannot play in the boys' competition this season has been handled "very poorly", with some players told mid-match.

title.children: Anger as young female footy players banned from boys' competition

image.altText: Silhouettes of multiple men standing alongside ornate Chinese wall decorations and three large windows

props.synopsis: The Australian share market closed at a two-month high after China said it was evaluating multiple approaches by the Trump administration for trade talks. US stocks continued to reclaim ground from their post-tariff losses. But Amazon's shares fell in extended trade.

title.children: Share market closes at two-month high as China says it's open to trade talks with US — As it happened

image.altText: A player holding a ball preparing to throw. Two players go head to head on the side

props.synopsis: Star Adelaide Thunderbirds defender Shamera Sterling-Humphrey will miss the remainder of the national netball season as she prepares to welcome her first child, with South African Sanmarie Visser announced as her replacement.

title.children: Adelaide Thunderbirds star 'so excited' to be welcoming first child

image.altText: Alan Davies stand-up promo

props.synopsis: The British comedian and star of the popular comedy panel show will tour Australia for the first time in a decade in November and December.

title.children: Comedian Alan Davies says he never remembers the facts from QI

image.altText: A map highlights locations in the north Pacific Ocean, near Hawai'i

props.synopsis: Scientists and legal experts warn against commercial deep-sea mining as US President Donald Trump signs an executive order opening up both US and international waters.

title.children: 'Inherently destructive': Trump's deep-sea mining order sparks backlash

image.altText: Anna Kendrick and Blake Lively stand next to each other and look seriously at the camera, there is a red background

props.synopsis: Blake Lively and Anna Kendrick come back to their world of fashion, martinis and murder for the equally deranged and delightful sequel to 2018's hit A Simple Favor.

title.children: Another Simple Favor is just as deranged and delightful as the first film
